body:
When I build `py-matplotlib+movies` (which pulls in a dependency on `ffmpeg`), matplotlib crashes when I try to save an MP4 file.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

It should be possible to follow any matplotlib animation tutorial like https://towardsdatascience.com/animations-with-matplotlib-d96375c5442c and save the result as an MP4 file to reproduce the issue.

### Error Message

```
MovieWriter stderr:
[h264_v4l2m2m @ 0x55dd693b2ec0] Could not find a valid device
[h264_v4l2m2m @ 0x55dd693b2ec0] can't configure encoder
Error initializing output stream 0:0 -- Error while opening encoder for output stream #0:0 - maybe incorrect parameters such as bit_rate, rate, width or height

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/adam/eclipse/.spack-env/view/lib/python3.7/site-packages/matplotlib/animation.py", line 251, in saving
    yield self
  File "/home/adam/eclipse/.spack-env/view/lib/python3.7/site-packages/matplotlib/animation.py", line 1137, in save
    writer.grab_frame(**savefig_kwargs)
  File "/home/adam/eclipse/.spack-env/view/lib/python3.7/site-packages/matplotlib/animation.py", line 363, in grab_frame
    dpi=self.dpi, **savefig_kwargs)
  File "/home/adam/eclipse/.spack-env/view/lib/python3.7/site-packages/matplotlib/figure.py", line 2311, in savefig
    self.canvas.print_figure(fname, **kwargs)
  File "/home/adam/eclipse/.spack-env/view/lib/python3.7/site-packages/matplotlib/backend_bases.py", line 2217, in print_figure
    **kwargs)
  File "/home/adam/eclipse/.spack-env/view/lib/python3.7/site-packages/matplotlib/backend_bases.py", line 1639, in wrapper
    return func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/adam/eclipse/.spack-env/view/lib/python3.7/site-packages/matplotlib/backends/backend_agg.py", line 456, in print_raw
    fh.write(renderer.buffer_rgba())
BrokenPipeError: [Errno 32] Broken pipe

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./plot.py", line 74, in <module>
    main(args)
  File "./plot.py", line 45, in main
    ani.save(fp)
  File "/home/adam/eclipse/.spack-env/view/lib/python3.7/site-packages/matplotlib/animation.py", line 1137, in save
    writer.grab_frame(**savefig_kwargs)
  File "/home/adam/eclipse/.spack-env/view/lib/python3.7/contextlib.py", line 130, in __exit__
    self.gen.throw(type, value, traceback)
  File "/home/adam/eclipse/.spack-env/view/lib/python3.7/site-packages/matplotlib/animation.py", line 253, in saving
    self.finish()
  File "/home/adam/eclipse/.spack-env/view/lib/python3.7/site-packages/matplotlib/animation.py", line 353, in finish
    self.cleanup()
  File "/home/adam/eclipse/.spack-env/view/lib/python3.7/site-packages/matplotlib/animation.py", line 390, in cleanup
    self._proc.returncode, self._proc.args, out, err)
subprocess.CalledProcessError: Command '['ffmpeg', '-f', 'rawvideo', '-vcodec', 'rawvideo', '-s', '640x480', '-pix_fmt', 'rgba', '-r', '5.0', '-loglevel', 'error', '-i', 'pipe:', '-vcodec', 'h264', '-pix_fmt', 'yuv420p', '-y', 'results/CO2.mp4']' returned non-zero exit status 1.
```

### Information on your system

* **Spack:** 0.14.2-2198-4a2136670
* **Python:** 3.7.8
* **Platform:** linux-ubuntu20.04-skylake

### Additional information

- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [x] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output

@xjrc I see that you're the maintainer for the `ffmpeg` package recipe. Any idea what's going wrong here? Maybe `py-matplotlib` needs to depend on a certain variant of `ffmpeg`? When I use the version of `ffmpeg` on my system, things work just fine.
title: Matplotlib + ffmpeg crashes when saving MP4 file
